abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The iOS & iPadOS 14 SDK provides support to develop apps for iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch devices running iOS & iPadOS 14. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 12, available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 12, see
Updating to iOS & iPadOS 14 from previous versions of iOS & iPadOS might take significantly longer than expected. Data loss could occur if the update is interrupted. (59101197)
macOS Big Sur 11 beta 6 or Xcode 12 might be required to sync or update devices running iOS & iPadOS 14 or later.
macOS Big Sur 11 beta 6 is required to use the restore images for iOS & iPadOS 14 or later.
You can now use Settings > Developer Settings to test an App Clip card. (64787288)
Avoid calling the
API until you’re able to create supported codes. (59351258)
enables downloading an app without having to leave the current app. The overlay can also be tapped to view the app in the App Store. In an App Clip,
enables users to download the corresponding full app from within the App Clip. (56886149)

You can now manage subscriptions, test upgrades, downgrades, and cancellations, as well as reset the introductory offer eligibility for a test account, by tapping on your sandbox account in Settings. (57248908)
The
parameter can now be passed to Account Authentication Modification Extensions during in-app upgrades. (64128404)
A new feature in
allows clients to request stereo polar patterns from the built-in mic. Clients choosing a stereo polar pattern must call a new method of
to specify the stereo input orientation. For more information, see
vended through the Game Controller framework (
) don’t support
and an error is returned on advanced player creation.
and
events sent to
vended through the Game Controller framework (
) are silently ignored. (65163373)
The creation of
via class initializers is available only in iOS. For other platforms, access these engines via
The default initializer on the auto-generated model interface has been deprecated in favor of
. Use
or the newly introduced
method and handle model load errors as appropriate. (64432588)

Beginning in iOS & iPadOS 14, fonts installed using configuration profiles are only available to apps supporting the font APIs and entitlements introduced in iOS & iPadOS 13. If your app provides a custom font-selection interface, it can no longer access fonts installed via configuration profiles. For reference, see the WWDC 2019 Session
New data types are available to track mobility metrics including walking speed, step length, double-support percentage, and more. (56387364)
enables reading electrocardiogram voltage data and classifications recorded by Apple Watch. (56396806)
Spotlight might not appear as expected. (64121178)
Workaround:
Restart your device.

Key-Value Observation removal facilities now employ deterministic bookkeeping methods. Cases that would have produced hard-to-diagnose crashes, especially those where KVO signals problems accessing deallocated observer pointers or observers associated with incorrect objects, now produce an exception that pinpoints which observed object needs a missed
call, and by which observers. This exception was previously thrown as ‘best effort’ when KVO could detect the problem; the new deterministic bookkeeping allows it to be thrown for all cases where
is needed.
The improved determinism also allows improved Swift API handling. Instances of
, produced by the Swift

method, take advantage of integration with this bookkeeping so they now invalidate automatically when the observed object is released, regardless of how the object implements its KVO behavior. This applies to all usage of this API in macOS 11 Big Sur beta, including on processes built with previous versions of the SDK, and eliminates certain classes of crashes that sometimes required using the legacy API instead. (65051563)
Three Simplified Chinese Wubi input methods are now supported: Wubi 86, Wubi 98, and Wubi New Century. (56277474)
QuickPath now supports swiping English words on the Simplified Chinese Pinyin keyboard. (56314466)
Typing numbers using the Japanese Kana keyboard has been significantly enhanced. (56285976)
CarPlay keyboard support has been added for over 100 additional languages. (56791047)
Irish Gaelic and Norwegian Nynorsk keyboards now support Auto-Correction. (53156919, 48183197)
New APIs are available for using
from Swift as part of the framework
A new type,
, can be instantiated using a subsystem and category and provides methods for logging at different levels (
The
APIs support specifying most formatting and privacy options supported by legacy
APIs.
The new APIs provide significant performance improvements over the legacy APIs.
You can now pass Swift string interpolation to the
function.
Note:
The new APIs can’t be back deployed; however, the existing
API remains available for back deployment. (22539144)
After updating to iOS & iPadOS 14 beta 2 or later, user data, such as Favorites, Collections, and Recents no longer syncs with devices running earlier versions of iOS & iPadOS. (65005848)
Experimental HTTP/3 support can be enabled in Safari Settings > Advanced > Experimental Features, and enabled system-wide in Developer settings. (62969220)
To properly render an augmented reality
with the post-processing effects available in

, the pipeline now writes depth information when rendering translucent materials. This makes the order that meshes are drawn more impactful for the final image. To properly author content for this pipeline, break up big meshes into smaller parts, especially when the meshes are intertwined. (66535399)
You can use
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/sirikit/inmediausercontext
, and Intents to improve media interactions and App Selection. For more information, see

Webpage Translation is now available in the U.S. and Canada. Supported languages include English, Spanish, Simplified Chinese, French, German, Russian, and Brazilian Portuguese. Safari will automatically detect if translation is available based on your Preferred Languages list. (64437861)

To receive a postback from devices running iOS 14 or later, generate signatures using signature version 2.0 or later. Version 1.0 signatures don’t result in a postback on iOS 14 and later, even if the advertised app is installed and launched. (71474331)
The
and
parameter values are now available in the version 2 install validation postback that the device sends to your ad network’s registered postback URL.
The
modifier and
aren’t currently functional. (65704705)
Rebuilding against the iOS 14 SDK will modify instances of
to scale with dynamic type. To create a font which doesn’t scale with dynamic type, use
The
view expands to fill its container. (64136568)
Workaround:
Apply a frame modifier.
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/view/body-body-8kl5o
is now implicitly a
and
is now implicitly a
can be converted to and from
. The
can also now be configured with a binding to a
Introduced
as a convenient way to place multiple items in a specific location of non-customizable toolbars. (64178863)
now supports adding a secondary “current value label” that describes the current progress level of the task. Use the
to describe the overall task, and the
to provide more specific details about the progress of the task. (63580200)
and
have updated protocol requirements:
Their initializer requirement now has a single
parameter that the
and
can be read from.
Their
functions that were expected to write to an inout
parameter are now
functions that return a
instead.
The document-based app templates in Xcode have been updated to reflect this change in API.
Source compatibility with the previous requirements will eventually be removed. (65146043)
and
are now available on iOS & iPadOS. (62614998)
is now redacted when the
modifier is applied. (65047189)
is now available and allows a

to appear in-line with the rest of the content in its surrounding container. The style will adapt its appearance for different containers and platforms, such as individual menu items in a menu. (59868844)
is now available and allows a
to present its options within a menu. This style will display its options within a submenu when the
is nested within a
, or
may now be used with
gains a new initializer accepting a
is now supported on iOS & iPadOS and can be used to create a button that shows a menu as its primary action. (59725999)
A new redaction reason API for applying placeholder
treatment is now available. (63288447)
The
and
APIs have been replaced with a collection of new view modifiers.
Use the new
modifier to present a system interface for importing one or more files into your app, and the new
modifier to move one or more existing files to a new location. The following is an example of a simple UI for importing and moving files:
Use the new

modifier to present a system interface for exporting one or more documents from your app. In this example, an app provides a simple note-taking interface for quickly jotting down some text and then exporting it to disk:

code: // Clear the draft now that it's saved.

inlineContent.text: Use the new
modifier to present a system interface for moving one or more existing files to a new location. (66182201)
Rebuilding against the iOS 14 SDK will change uses of
to reliably top-leading align the views inside the
. This was the previous behavior, except when it was not possible to detect a single static view inside the
Apps using JSONKit might quit unexpectedly on launch. Some forks of JSONKit hardcode private, pointer-representation details, which are subject to change. (60290929)
Workaround:
Use
instead.
has been removed. You can no longer use Filesystem contents outside of an app’s sandbox for validation. (61098152)

Apps using the NativeScript framework might quit unexpectedly on launch. NativeScript performs an unsafe operation to determine if an arbitrary pointer is an Objective-C object pointer. You can temporarily resolve this issue by using
instead of reading the
directly; however, update this code to avoid checking whether arbitrary pointers are Objective-C object pointers. (62913064)
The
class is deprecated. Use
instances instead. (63690311)
Voice Control is now available in English (United Kingdom) and English (India). (55904557)
doesn’t ensure uniform availability of pass library functionality between platforms and devices. (60697880)
Workaround:
Call a more specific API to check available functionality, such as

Apple Pay support is now available to Mac Catalyst apps. Two methods have been added to existing delegate protocols. No changes are required for iPad apps, but one or both of these methods must be implemented when building for Catalyst. (64187739)
The first method is an addition to the
protocol:
. This method is required for Catalyst when using
, because
, unlike
, doesn’t have knowledge of the window requesting presentation of the payment sheet. Pass back the
instance displaying the UI requesting the payment, for example,
. This method is marked as required when building for Catalyst, but is otherwise optional.
The second method depends on whether you’re using
or
. For
, use
. For
, use

This method must be implemented to request a merchant session via your server, and return it via the handler. This mirrors the security model used in WebKit, and replaces listing merchant IDs in the app’s Apple Pay entitlements. This method in turn uses the following class to send back results:
Government alerts about certain severe weather events including tornados, winter storms, flash floods, and more are now available in the U.S., Europe, Japan, Canada, and Australia. (58931042)
When the parent app of a widget has been granted Selected Photos access, an alert might appear each time the widget runs. (66398732)
Workaround:
Add
to the Info.plist of the widget extension.
All widgets must be rebuilt using the iOS & iPadOS 14 beta 4 SDK or later, and won’t run on previous versions of iOS & iPadOS 14 beta. (65290210)
Some widgets might disappear from your Home Screen after updating to iOS & iPadOS 14 beta 2 or later. (64823469)
Workaround:
Add the missing widgets back to your Home Screen.
You can’t resize an existing widget. (63500799)
Workaround:
Remove the widget and re-add it at the desired size.
You might need to reconfigure your widgets after updating to iOS & iPadOS 14 Beta 3 or later. (65485709)
The Weather widget might appear blank after updating to iOS 14 beta 6 or later. (66782070)
Workaround:
Tap the widget to open the Weather app, then return to the widget on the Home screen.

abstract.text: An object that communicates to the system how you intend to use audio in your app.
The view that creates the Sign in with Apple button for display.
A protocol that defines an advanced pattern player capable of looping, seeking, pausing, and resuming haptic playback.
An object that represents the connection to the haptic server.
An audio event with a looped waveform of arbitrary length.
An audio event using a waveform that you supply.
Add search capabilities to your app, and index your content so people can find it from Spotlight and Safari.
A representation of a real game controller, a virtual controller, or a snapshot of a controller.
The locations of haptic actuators on a game controller.
A sample for electrocardiogram data.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the device supports adding passes.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the pass library is available.
An object that presents a sheet that prompts the user to authorize a payment request.
Methods that let you respond to user interactions with your payment authorization controller.
Requests an object that validates the identity of a merchant for a payment request.
Returns the window in which to present a payment authorization sheet.
An object that presents a sheet that prompts the user to authorize a payment request.
Requests an object that validates the identity of a merchant for a payment request.
Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
A container that holds the collection of entities that an AR view renders.
Fine-tune voice controls and improve Siri Suggestions by sharing app capabilities, customized names, and listening habits with the system.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Improving Siri Media Interactions and App Selection

abstract.text: A class that displays an overlay you can use to recommend another app or an App Clip’s corresponding full app.
Displays a sheet that enables customers to redeem subscription offer codes that you configure in App Store Connect.
The content and behavior of the app.
A representation of a color that adapts to a given context.
A control used to select a color from the system color picker UI.
Command menus are stand-alone, top-level containers for controls that perform related, app-specific commands.
Conforming types represent a group of related commands that can be exposed to the user via the main menu on macOS and key commands on iOS.
A container for views that you present as menu items in a context menu.
A type that you use to serialize documents to and from file.
The configuration for reading file contents.
Create a custom font with the given `name` and a fixed `size` that does not scale with Dynamic Type.
Create a custom font with the given `name` and `size` that scales with the body text style.
A container view that defines its content as a function of its own size and coordinate space.
A view that displays an image.
A `PickerStyle` where each option is displayed inline with other views in the current container.
Keyboard shortcuts describe combinations of keys on a keyboard that the user can press in order to activate a button or toggle.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column, optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
A control for presenting a menu of actions.
A picker style that presents the options as a menu when the user presses a button, or as a submenu when nested within a larger menu.
A control for selecting from a set of mutually exclusive values.
A view that shows the progress toward completion of a task.
A type-erased label that describes the current value of a progress view.
A view that describes the task represented by the progress view.
A type that you use to serialize reference type documents to and from file.
Adds commands to the scene.
A result builder for composing a collection of scenes into a single composite scene.
A view that provides programmatic scrolling, by working with a proxy to scroll to known child views.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
A model that represents a group of `ToolbarItem`s which can be placed in the toolbar or navigation bar.
A custom parameter attribute that constructs views from closures.
An observation that provides the points the analysis recognized.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
A representation of a node (a file, directory, or symbolic link) in the file system.
An abstract class that declares an interface for objects that create, interpret, and validate the textual representation of values.
Removes all entries specifying an observer from the notification center's dispatch table.
An object that converts between JSON and the equivalent Foundation objects.
Returns the class of an object.
An object for writing interpolated string messages to the unified logging system.
Capture telemetry from your app for debugging and performance analysis using the unified logging system.
Sends a default-level message to the logging system.
The Quartz color that corresponds to the color object.
